description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: A Long Way from Home

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: Things Fall Apart

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: Childhood's End

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: Winds of Change

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: African Nightmare

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: Alarms and Excursions

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: It's Hard To Be a Hero

description: Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.
name: The House of Baba Yaga

description:
Original Marvel UK series featuring new Captain Britain stories by Alan Davis plus backup strips starring Night Raven and Abslom Daak.

Final issue.
name: Should Auld Acquaintance

description:
Killraven reminisces on his childhood amidst Mint Juleps' attack. Having awakened, Mint Julep asks Killraven to join her on her mission to find out more about Martians' science and possibly lovers. Refusing her ultimatum, Killraven must now face the wrath of MINT JULEP!!

Killraven and his Freeman hook up with Mint Jupid and Volcana Ash.Weird mutants aboard her headquarters-a train car strung up to balloon.
name: War of the Worlds 2

description: Follow Killraven against his fight among Mint Julep and the Martians. But it's not all hate when a STEAMY romance between Volcana and Killraven starts smoldering.
name: War of the Worlds 4

description: The Martians have discovered that Killraven is essential to execute their plans.
name: War of the Worlds 5

description: Grok reveals his true self and his powers to Killraven, M'Shulla and Volcana. Grok who insists on teaming up with the Martians for total control, meets his fate when Killraven willingly fights for the Martian to defeat him.
name: War of the Worlds 6

description: After discovering a mutated fish as a result of the martian's experiments, Killraven and the Freemen encounter a group of masked men who call themselves "The Devil Horde" taking advantage of the towns people.
name: War of the Worlds 3

description:
Fighting Side-By-Side

A story featuring the Human Torch and Namor the Sub-Mariner. Produced by Carl Burgos and Bill Everett.

Mor the Mighty

A story featuring Professor Zog and his robot Electro. Produced by Steve Dahlman.

War Against the Werewolf

A story featuring the Angel. Produced by Paul Gustavson.

Burk and the Bomber

A story featuring Terry Vance the Schoolboy Sleuth. Produced by Ray Gill and Bob Oksner.

Hoodlums, Inc.

A story featuring the Vision. Produced by Joe Simon and Jack Kirby.

The Legacy of John Rand

A story featuring Ka-Zar. Produced by Ben Thompson.

Thin Ice

A two-page text story featuring Terry Vance. Written by Ray Gill.
name: Fighting Side-By-Side

description:
Overview

GEN13 welcomes acclaimed writer Simon Oliver (THE EXTERMINATORS) as he joins artists Carlo Barberi and Drew Geraci! After surviving the last, brutal gasp of the Tabula Rasa, the kids decide to do what any other teenage superhero team would want to do — they head to New York City! But the kids will soon discover that the Big Apple's got a rotten core as their most harrowing journey is about to begin!
name: 15 Minutes, Part 1

description:
Overview

Written by Gail Simone; Art and Cover by Neil Googe

It's a battle royal as the citizens of Tranquility take to the skies to battle the undead Astral Man! Can the heroes overcome the greatest threat ever to their city?
name: No More Crossovers!

description:
Overview

Daredevil fights the Enforcers and their new boss Mr. Fear, who’s trying to tear the streets of Hell's Kitchen apart, while Matt and Foggy fight a battle on another front --- the courtroom --- to save the life of someone close to them!

Continuing the events that began in DAREDEVIL 99 and rocketed us into the landmark 100th issue, by the multiple Eisner-nominated team of Brubaker and Lark!
name: Without Fear: Part Three Of Six

description: The heroes split up on seperate missions throughout the Godwheel. Hardware and Flygirl facedown Lord Pumpkin, who kills the latter.
This wiki page is a stub. Hit the edit button above to add to this article.
name: The Return of the Great Pumpkin

description: PFC Ed Marks arrives to Vietnam in 1966. He gets his first taste of the reality of the war when VC tries to destroy his plane on Saigon and when he fails to bribe the sergant in infantry HQ and is assigned to combat unit. On a search and destroy mission in the bush he sees the cruel reality of jungle warfare.
name: 'Nam: First Patrol

description:
1. Demon of Destruction (reprinted in: Adventures into the Unknown #1)

2. Love of a Vampire

3. The Way of a Werewolf

4. Army of Bethune (True Ghosts)

5. The Monster Doll
name: Demon of Destruction

description:
Contains:

The Haunting of the White House

Tomb of Fire

Spectres of Silver Cliffs

Fear on Ice

Of Men and Weird Monsters (a text story)

Contains:

Spectre in the Surf

The Midnight Ghost

Phantoms on Parade (a text story)

The Death-Demon of Prague

Goliath! The Wasp! Hawkeye! The Black Panther! The Vision! They are... Earth's Mightiest Heroes?! Beginning a second look into the history of the Avengers in this all-new mini-series written by original EARTH'S MIGHTIEST HEROES scribe, Joe Casey. A new team has risen to supplant the original legends -- and these members have to prove their worth all over again. Can Goliath withstand the pressures of leadership? Can the Black Panther reconcile his duties as both king and Avenger? Can Hawkeye survive his own dysfunctional love life? And will the public ever accept the Vision as a hero? An all-new, previously untold adventure featuring the mostly unlikely Avengers lineup of all! With covers by Dave Johnson (100 Bullets).

1. The Holiday Spirit! (public service message by Superboy) -- 2. Anti-Superman Weapon (Superman) -- 3. Varsity Vic (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. I Rode With the Outlaw Cameleers (Congo Bill) -- 5. Jerry Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 6. The Children from Space (Tommy Tomorrow) -- 7. Private Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 8. Five Bandannas for Vigilante (Vigilante)

Lex Luthor: You've destroyed all my secret weapons Superman -- but this one will surely destroy you!

Superman (thought): What can be in that box? It's lead lined -- and even my x-ray vision can't help me!

"Also: Tommy Tomorrow Space Planeteer"
name: The Anti-Superman Weapon

description:
Notes:

  • Metallo, the Guardian and Dubbilex cameo flashback appearances.
  • Clark Kent begins a new job working at Newstime.
  • First appearance of Brainiac's Skull Ship in the Modern Age.
name: Man and Machine

description: 1. Frankentweety! (Sylvester, Tweety Bird, Bugs Bunny, Elmer Fudd, Taz the Tasmanian Devil : a Frankenstein parody in which Looney Tunes characters get their brains switched) -- 2. Precious Cargo (Bugs Bunny vs Yosemite Sam) -- 3. Southern Fried Foghorn (Foghorn Leghorn, Dawg, Taz)
name: Frankentweety!

description:
Notes

  • Brief retelling of the origin of Metallo.
  • Dr. Emmett Vale, Lois Lane and Robotman flashback.
name: Body and Mind

description: In this month's issue, Bugs gives Marvin the Martian a makeover in "Bad Hare Day," Sylvester Jr. fears a ghost in the basement in "The Terror From Down Under," and Daffy tries his hand at stand-up comedy in "Wise Quacker."
name: Bad Hare Day; The Terror from Down Under; Wise Quacker

description: 1. The City That Was For Sale (Superman) -- 2. Casey the Cop (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 3. The Master of 1000 Duels (Green Arrow) -- 4. The Battle of the Beasts (Tom Sparks, Boy Inventor) -- 5. Valley of Dusty Death (Wyoming Kid) -- 6. Quick Quiz -- 7. Passage to Peru (Danger Trail) -- 8. Varisty Vic (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 9. Professor Eureka (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 10. Stages Through The Ages (full text article) -- 11. The Private Life of Commissioner Gordon (Batman, Robin, Commissioner James Gordon) -- 12. Sweet Land of Liberty (public service message by Peter Porkchops)

Bongo proudly presents the first of many seasonal specials to come with this comic cornucopia of winter-themed stories. Find out what Santa Claus really thinks of the people of Springfield; shovel snow with Angry Dad; celebrate Hannukah with Krusty; go Christmas caroling with Bart, Lisa, and Milhouse; find out if Homer can keep his New Year's resolutions; and more! Plus, this one-of-a-kind issue also comes with a one-of-a-kind picture frame! It's a winter wonderland of spirited Simpsons this November!

  1. Springfield's Letters to Santa
  2. Angry Dad by Bart Simpson
  3. Hot Cider in the City
  4. Homer's New Year's Resolutions
  5. Itchy & Scratchy in The Gift That Keeps on Giving
  6. The Gift of the Maccabees
  7. Snow Falling on Cheaters
  8. Simpsons Picture Frame
name: Springfield's Letters to Santa; Angry Dad by Bart Simpson; Hot Cider in the City; Homer's New Year's Resolutions; Itchy & Scratchy in The Gift That Keeps on Giving; The Gift of the Maccabees; Snow Falling on Cheaters; Simpsons Picture Frame

description:
A new generation of adventure begins as superstar writer Gail Simone (Birds of Prey, Villains United) and artists Talent Caldwell and Matt "Batt" Banning (Wildcats: Nemesis) join forces to reimagine the classic WildStorm teen team!

The life of a teenager can be a strange enough experience, but when super-powers are added to the mix things get a whole lot more confusing in a hurry! Meet Caitlin, Sarah, Roxy, Bobby, and Eddie — outcast teenagers from different parts of the country who quickly learn they all have something in common: abilities far beyond those of their classmates! But what's the secret to these wonderful and scary powers, and what role do the nefarious Tabula Rasa and International Operations play?
name: Best of a Bad Lot, Part 1 - And on the First Day

description: The new mysteries of the teenage super-team unfold, courtesy of writer Gail Simone and artists Talent Caldwell and Batt! Following the manifestation of their powers, the kids find themselves at the mercy of I.O. and their "doctors." But what's the ultimate motivation for the battery of tests and experiments being performed on the kids? Is there have any hope of escape? And how does John Lynch play into everything?
name: Best Of A Bad Lot, Part 2 - Never Be Divided

description:
1. Cover by Kurt Schaffenberger.
  2. "The Kid Who Adopted Jimmy Olsen" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Val, Perry White, Lois Lane) written by Leo Dorfman, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger.
  3. "Both Feet in the Grave" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman) written by Leo Dorfman, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger.
  4. "The Green Sun Supergirl!" Reprinted from Action Comics #337.
  5. "The "Superman-Lois" Hit Record!" Reprinted from Superman's Girl Friend, Lois Lane #45.
  6. "The Reporter of 1,000 Faces!" two pages of 9 panels highlighting Jimmy Olsen's use of disguises. Stories highlighted are from Superman's Pal, Jimmy Olsen #12, #21, #27, #36, #38, #44, #47 and #74 .
  7. "The Invulnerable Imp!" Reprinted from Superboy #120.

Notes:

  • This issue contains the Hostess Superhero Ad, Batman and Robin and "The Mummy".
name: The Kid Who Adopted Jimmy Olsen / Both Feet in the Grave

description: Following the harrowing events of GEN13 #3, learn the fate of the re-captured team member! Will the other Gen13ers come together save their fallen comrade, or will they go their separate ways?
name: Best Of A Bad Lot, Part 4 - Captive Audience

description: A vicious battle with the psychotic Heaven Zeleven leaves the unprepared Gen13 kids shattered and divided, perhaps permanently. Is there a traitor in the ranks? The high-octane superhero madness continues!
name: Best Of A Bad Lot, Part 5 - Grounded

description: A vicious battle with the psychotic Heaven Zeleven leaves the unprepared Gen13 kids shattered and divided, perhaps permanently. Is there a traitor in the ranks? The high-octane superhero madness continues!
name: It Begins!

description: The kids have escaped I.O.'s clutches and are on the run! But when you have no money, no family and no clue where you're running, is survival even possible? Can five complete strangers learn to work as a team in time to avoid their aggressive pursuers, led by John Lynch?
name: Best Of A Bad Lot, Part 3 - Eye Candy

description: The Gen13 kids tumble into Tranquility! On the run from I.O., the teens have taken refuge in the small town of Tranquility and are finding it difficult to relax. But the kind, open nature of the townsfolk has them suspicious...is all as it seems in this town?
name: Road Trip, Part 2 - One Shot Of A Long, Dark Road

description: Prepare yourself for the full fury of Gen13's atomic redhead, as she finds herself alone and surrounded by flesh-eating dinosaurs! This marks the reunion of the classic creative team of Gail Simone and Udon's Alvin Lee (Deadpool/Agent X) in a special stand-alone issue. Miss it at your peril!
name: When Caitlin Ruled The Lizards

description: It's goth meets geek as the Gen13 kids run afoul of Tranquility's garage band metahumans, the Liberty Snots. These teen legacy heroes drip pretension from every clammy, powdered pore and have no love for the somewhat-less-affected children of Tabula Rasa. It's a classic battle of outsiders!
name: Road Trip, Part 4 - Battle Of The Band Of Brothers

description:
1. The Invisible Lois Lane! (Lois Lane, Superman, Perry White, Professor Potter) -- 2. Varsity Vic (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 3. Lois Lane's Signal Watch! (Lois Lane, Jimmy Olsen, Perry, Supergirl) -- 4. Touchdown for Picasso! (public service message : even football players can appreciate fine art) -- 5. The Girl Who Refused to Marry Superman! (Lois Lane, Superman, Lana Lang, Jimmy, Perry, red Kryptonite) -- 6. Jerry Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

Superman: Lois and Lana... a freak accident has taken away my super-powers and made me an invalid! Now that I'll be an ordinary man for life, I'm sure neither of you will want to marry me!

1st woman (Lois or Lana): You'll never be ordinary to me! You'll always be you, the man I love! I'll marry you!

2nd woman (Lois or Lana): I'll be honest with you, Superman! Without your super-powers, I wouldn't dream of marrying you!

"Featuring a modern lady or the tiger puzzle! Can you guess... 'The Girl Who Refused to Marry Superman!'"
name: The Girl Who Refused to Marry Superman!

description:
1. "The Day Lois Lane Vanished!" (Lois Lane, Superman, Jimmy Olsen, Perry White, Lana Lang, Lucy Lane) -- 2. "The Madam Jekyll of Metropolis!" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger. (Lois Lane, Jimmy Olsen, Perry White, Lana Lang, Lucy Lane, Professor Potter) -- 3. "Cora the Car Hop" (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. "Lana Lang's Romance with Superman III!" written by Unknown, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by George Klein. (Lois Lane, Superman, Jimmy Olsen, Perry White, Lana Lang : an imaginary story)

Future Superman: Marry me Lana, and I will give you super-powers just as my ancestor the original Superman, gave them to his wife, Lois Lane!

Lana Lang (thought): How ironic! If I say yes, I'll be marrying the descendant of my former rival-- Lois Lane!
name: Lana Lang's Romance with Superman III

description: Packaged with Wizard's X-Men Special Edition #1. Includes profiles of the various X-characters.
name: Cerebro's Guide to the X-Men

volume.name: Wizard Presents Cerebro’s Guide to the X-Men

description: “LITTLE GREEN MEN” Someone get them a road map! The new Fantastic Four have just taken another wrong turn on the dimensional superhighway -- and this time, they’ve landed in the middle of a gang-war between machine-gun toting Skrulls! Gangsta-gangsta!
name: Dead Or Alive?, Part 2: Gangsta Lean

description:
Overview

Could DEADPOOL's recent actions be responsible for unleashing the Hoary Hosts of Hoggoth on Earth?

Can the Crimson Bands of Cytorrak keep DEADPOOL's mouth shut? Will BOB, Agent of Hydra, sprout flame on his head and become the new Dread Dormammu? Shall DR. STRANGE truly suffer through an entire issue dragging our reluctant heroes through mystic realms? The answers are Yes, No, Maybe, Most Likely, but not necessarily in that order. And in a stunning escalation to our simmering sub-plot, CABLE is still dead!
name: I Need A Trip Trough The Netherrealms Like A Kick In The Nether Regions

description: It all comes down to this! Nearly every friend and ally the Sub-Mariner ever had has turned their back on him, and Namor has learned the shocking truth about the Atlantean sleeper cell and its leader! Don’t miss this explosive final issue, as writers Matt Cherniss and Peter Johnson (POWERLESS) and artist Phil Briones (WHITE TIGER) finally reveal all! Who’s the mysterious man supporting Namor when all others have spurned him? Who destroyed Atlantis? And is Namor dead for good?
name: Revolution, Part 6

description: The Zombies' own Civil War continues here! The undead former heroes return to Earth in search of new food --- but does anything exist on the world they picked barren decades ago? And if there is, can our ghoulish group put their differences aside long enough to feast --- or are they doomed to rip each other apart instead? You know whose side you were on, but now it's time to find out whose stomach you're in!
name: [untitled]

description:
Superman has his hands full with keeping Metropolis intact! Lex Luthor attempts to use the city's technology to terraform the rest of the country in his bid for the presidency. Satanus tries to control the city's soul by using Superman's friends and foes to get it. And a mysterious Native American woman just wants to take Metropolis back for her people. Will the Man of Steel be able to keep his city safe?

Superman and Lord Satanus fight over the soul of Metropolis.

Cover title: Dark City

"Vote Lex 2000"

"2000 48"--Superman "S" in upper left hand corner.
name: Doubles

description:
The Catalyst - Following an attempt by Professor X to aid NASA in the search for extra-terrestrial life, he and his five X-Men discover that all their mutant abilities have disappeared - and that's when the Sentinels attack!

Marvel Witch - Investigating recent thefts at a museum, Marvel Girl and the Scarlet Witch Find themselves going on a subterrenean adventure.
name: The Catalyst; Marvel Witch

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
Overview

Some people come to New York City looking for a knight in shining armor. Or just a warm body who can help you through the lonely hours. Be careful what you look for. Hot crime novelist Duane Swierczynski (“The Blonde”) and Jefte Paolo bring you the story of three women whose lives intersect in strange and deadly ways, two predators who stalk the city streets at night, and one shock ending you won’t see coming. No matter how many bad dates you’ve had.
name: Date Night

description:
Fresh from the Marvel Zombies vs. AOD Cross-over! - well, not "minty" fresh, but fresh enough - from his appearance in the Universe of the Marvel Zombies, our un-intrepid hero has returned to his own world - but what a world it's become!

Evil Ash and his Deadite hordes rule the land and everywhere Ash turns is filled with mutants and monsters! Can Ash J. Williams gather his "chosen" and take down the Deadite hordes and restore order to the world?

Read on and find out!

All the action and post-apocalyptic excitement is once again brought to you from the creative team of James Kuhoric and artist Fernando Blanco and features a stunning painted cover from Arthur (Savage Tales, Marvel Zombies) Suydam!
name: From the Ashes

description:
Lex Luthor wins the Presidency. Will Superman have the votes recounted or will he accept Lex as Commander in Chief?

"Vote Lex 2000"

"The American Way"

"2000 52"--Superman "S" in upper left hand corner
name: Soul of the City!

description:
Superboy guest stars in a tale of two cities, contrasting the new mega-city of Metropolis and the prototypically rural Smallville. After making sure that the transformed Metropolis is safe, Superman decides to head back to the homestead for a little R & R, and is surprised to find the Teen of Steel hanging around the family farm. Can Clark keep his secret identity hidden with the Kid around?

"Return to Smallville"

"2000 14"--Superman "S" in upper left hand corner.

After having trouble in the city, Clark decieds to visit Ma and Pa at the farm and have a relaxing time, but Superboy is at home and making himself comfortable.
name: The Private Life of Clark Kent

description:
"Superman Vs. The Parasite!"

The new, improved Parasite strikes and when he does the Man of Steel feels it like never before! Plus, both Lana Lang and Wonder Woman visit Metropolis, which doesn't help the strained marital relations between Lois and Clark.

"2000 18"--Superman "S" in upper left hand corner.
name: The Tender Trap

description: The entire cast of Hawaiian Dick returns in this brand new ongoing series. Byrd meets a World War II flying squadron, who soon find themselves under attack by a Japanese fighter plane--in 1954! Meanwhile, old enemies begin to re-emerge. Art by TEK JANSEN and NORTHWEST PASSAGE artist SCOTT CHANTLER. ONGOING TROPICAL NOIR! THE MULTI-EISNER NOMINATED SERIES RETURNS!
name: Screaming Black Thunder, Part 1

description: 1953, Hawaii. WWII vet Byrd is thrown off his stateside police force after an "incident" with a suspect. Having nowhere else to go, Byrd turns to his Army buddy, Mo Kalama, a detective in Hawaii. He now spends his days drinking tropical concoctions and his nights helping Mo with cases that fall just beyond the jurisdiction of the police. And in Byrd's Hawaii, the supernatural manifestations of the islands' myths and legends lie just around every corner. Byrd and Mo are hired to locate the mistress of the island's notorious drug lord, Bishop Masaki. The good news is they've already found the girl. The bad news is she's dead. The really bad news is that her body has mysteriously disappeared without a trace. The detectives scramble to stay ahead of the game as the true identity of the dead girl is uncovered and the terrifying secret of her disappearance is revealed.
name: Carried Away

description:
Plot Summary

The Series begins in New York City, with Jackie Estacado being introduced as he is stalking an undisclosed person for his "Uncle" Frankie Franchetti. The two suspect that this man has been scamming the Franchetti Crime Family and decide on a whim that he would be better off dead. With that, Jackie turns on his red sports car, crushes the man's lower body with the car and then shoot him several times until he's dead.

He then goes to the bar where he meets Jenny Romano and asks for a glass of milk, much to the latter's surprise. He's then seen flirting with some of the girls inside the bar and eventually leaves with one of them, telling her that he can get her a walk-on part in The Simpsons. Whilst he's at his home with the woman, the reader is introduced to Sonatine, who is spying on him through a mystical source, as well as the current wielder of the Angelus, who wants to kill him the moment he gains The Darkness, hoping to end the Estacado family line once and for all.

The next day he meets up with Uncle Frankie, who is in the middle of dealing with some problems he having with some of his competitors. A Frag grenade gets thrown into the room and Jackie saves Don Franchetti by throwing Mo on top of it. He apologizes to the dying Mo, who tells Jackie not to worry about it and admits that he had betrayed the Franchetti Family. Later when he is seen loading his gun when, precisely at midnight, he starts hearing The Darkness for the first time, falling to the ground in intense pain. Two groups are then seen attacking Jackie. The first is the Brotherhood of Darkness and the second one is a group of the Angelus' warriors. The Brotherhood is easily overwhelmed by the latter group, which are eventually killed off by Jackie using the Darkness for the first time. An enforcer from a rival mafia family then enters and attempts to kill Jackie, but the Estacado manages to save himself by summoning his armor around his body and killing the intruder. He later goes to the mansion of Don Marchianni and manages to kill him by summoning Darkness up the toilet.
name: Coming of Age

description: 1. Perils of Poor Lois! (Superman, Lois Lane : possibly the first imaginary story) -- 2. The Superman Badge (Private Pete : gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)) -- 3. The King of Crackpot Lane!! (Superman, Lois, Jimmy Olsen) -- 4. Gags (gags by Henry Boltinoff) -- 5. Words of Fire (full text story) -- 6. Life's Little Laffs (gag strip by Ray Houlihan) -- 7. Surprise For Superman (Superman, Lois, Perry White, Daily Planet building) -- 8. Jerry the Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 9. Suicide Voyage! (Superman, Lois, Perry)
Jackie tries to get a grasp on his powers, he even makes an attempt making a human female out of the Darkness, although it doesn't turn out quite as he hoped for.
name: Playing God

description: Italians and Yakuza form a truce, but jackie without knowing it goes and kills some of their men.
name: Issue 8

description: All sides are directed to one place. Sonatine influences Ian to help him.
name: Family Ties, Part 2

description: Meeting takes place in National Museum. White Bulls and Japanese have a firefight while Witchblade and Darkness battle. Ian Nottingham steps in and does something unexpected.
name: Family Ties, Part 3

description:
1. "The Man Superman Refused To Help" (Superman, Lois Lane, Perry White, Jimmy Olsen)
  2. "I Sustain the Wings" (Superman, Perry White, Lois Lane) reprinted in DC 100-Page Super Spectacular #18 & America at War: The Best of DC War Comics #1 - TPB.
  3. Private Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  4. "King of the Comic Books" (Superman, Lois, Jimmy) reprinted in Superman #284.
  5. "Fair Exchange" (full text story)
  6. "How They Knock Out a Jap Machine Gun Nest" (Facts About the Service by Jack Lehti)
  7. Quick Quiz
  8. "Hijack--Jackal of Crime" (Superman vs Hijack, Lois Lane, Jimmy Olsen, Daily Planet)

All stories reprinted in Superman Archives #7.
name: Your Friend, Superman

description: This issue boasts an impressive 15 different covers. It tells of Frankie's daughter Appolonia and how she wants to take over. She has a grudge against Jackie.
name: Hearts of Darkness, Part One

description: Jackie's life is in danger. Sonatine and Apolonia Franchetti are ready to bring The Angelus back to life. But The Angelus will choose another host.
name: Hearts of Darkness, Part 3

description: The first appearance of the Magdalena.
name: Spear of Destiny, Part 1

description: Don't miss the first two issues of a blood-soaked 6-part miniseries drawing together three of horror's greatest characters! In the bloody wake of the hit movie Freddy vs. Jason, Freddy Krueger finds himself clinging to the last shred of fear that allows him to exist…inside the demented mind of Jason Voorhees. Unwillingly bonded together, the murderous pair must seek out the Necronomicon, the only solution to their mutual torment. Nothing can stop this unholy alliance -- except the wisecracking, chainsaw-wielding Ash, aimed at destroying the Book of the Dead once and for all!

volume.name: Freddy vs Jason vs Ash (of Army of Darkness)

description: What can we say? It had to be a double-size issue, just to fit in all the excitement and action and just plain weirdness that occurs as... The Darkness takes Las Vegas! Not that Jackie Estacado is a gamblin' man, but he finds himself in the city of sin when he tries to learn just who had the gall to steal his identity! The question is, can he get it back before the mysterious Angelus gets The Darkness in her sights?! Of course, the Angelus herself has her own problems when she comes tooth to claw with a long lost member of the Estacado family! And if you think she's surprised, imagine how Jackie feels?! This issue features just about every character seen in The Darkness and has an ending that will shock even the most hardened comic fan!

Remember The Darkness #1? Remember Joey "The Scar" Scarpaggio? No? Really? He was the mook that Jackie killed on the last evening before he became The Darkness! Well, it turns out he wasn't a mook at all!! In fact, he was an undercover FBI Agent! And if you thought the Mob takes care of its own, wait until you see what one renegade federal agent brings to bear on Jackie Estacado, and all the Darklings in Hell might not be enough to protect him!

As the FBI continues its assault on Jackie Estacado, he must enlist the help of an unlikely ally to save himself. But will even THIS be enough to keep Jackie from the hands of the U.S. government? We don't know--Uncle Sam is a pretty tough opponent for ANYONE, even someone with the power of The Darkness...

DARKNESS MONTH CONTINUES! Part 4. The Darkness/Witchblade crossover concludes HERE! JACKIE ESTACADO--a broken man? As impossible as it seems, after months of battling the Angelus, a certain unnamed caped crusader, and a host of other baddies, even the power of the DARKNESS is not enough to protect him anymore. Instead, he must turn to the most unlikely ally of all for help... his power's ancient enemy, Sara Pezzini and the WITCHBLADE! Don't miss this momentous turning point in the life of the man known as the DARKNESS, the ramifications of which will be felt over the next year!

Jackie rips out Darkness part from Witchblade making it easier to control. Cull and Necrobi are defeated.
name: Witchblade/The Darkness, Part 4

description: Airplane high jinks ensue as the "High Noon" story line takes off! Jackie may be flying first class, but no one filled the Darklings in on proper airplane etiquette. To make matters worse, all hell breaks loose when Jackie reaches the baggage claim! Unknown gunmen in trench coats are cutting loose! Innocent luggage is lost in the fray! And the gunmen have abducted Carter, the stewardesses' young son, but why?!?
name: High Noon, Part 1

description: It's "High Noon" part two as Jackie1s hot on the trail of the gunmen who kidnapped young Carter! He's going to need the full power of The Darkness if he is to save him though because the welcoming party he's about to receive wants to introduce Jackie to his maker! Plus, more light is shed on Jackie's past and The Darklings enjoy an ambulance ride which you will not soon forget!
name: High Noon, Part 2

description: The "High Noon" story line concludes in grand fashion as a little boys fate is left in the hands of Jackie, the most unlikely of saviors. But, how can even Jackie save himself being trapped upon an oil rig, surrounded by gun toting thugs, in the middle of water, during broad daylight!?! Could it get any worse? We even wonder if The Darkness and his little pals can save the day this time!
name: High Noon, Part 3

description: Who is it that has a nastier mean streak than Jackie? Who can make the most formidable of men wet their pants? Who looks like a vision of heaven but acts like a creature from hell? Her name is Capris, the one and only sister of Jackie Estacado, and she's out for blood! Learn how one of the most innocent of young girls became a one woman wrecking machine and how the sister of The Darkness prepared for her "Dark Days Ahead".
name: Dark Days Ahead

description: Sometimes you can learn more about a person by hanging out with that person's sister. Family, as they say, is everything. This two part story (by Scott Lobdell and guest penciler Brian Ching) explores The Darkness from a a whole different angle, as we get to learn about the past of Jackie's twin sister, Capris Castagliano. For all those fans who have been following the exploits of Mr. Estacado -- you might be surprised to discover he's the good twin! (Both this issue and the next set up for the extended story arc starting in Darkness #35 -- featuring the return of Ripclaw!)

One word: RIPCLAW That's right! CYBERFORCE'S favorite Native American Indian has tracked Jackie Estacado right through his cover in the Witness Protection Program (where Jackie is assigned while waiting to testify at Uncle Frankie's coming trial) here in Miami. But don't think Robert Bearclaw intends to use his cybernetic implants to simply kill The Darkness -- he's got bigger plans in store! In fact, so big are these plans, they can't be contained in one story! This issue begins a five part story arc that will help pave the way not only for the future of this book -- but also the future relaunch of the book that started TOP COW COMICS! Any guesses?
name: Ripclaw (Part One)

description: There are some things a man just shouldn't know about himself...and Jackie is exposed to them all when his Spirit Guide -- the former Cyberforce mainstay known as Ripclaw -- takes him on a mystical mystery tour of his life. It's all part of a cram course in the power of the Darkness, as Jackie prepares to battle the enigmatic Conquistador and his army of baby faced warriors. All this, and who does Robert Bearclaw put in charge of guarding their bodies while they tour the spirit planes? Capris Castagilione, Jackie's twisted twin sister!
name: Ripclaw (Part Two)

description:
Now that The Darkness has been shown the light by RIPCLAW, will he truly join forces with him? If Ripclaw gets his way, this could be a one of the scariest team-ups ever! With Jackie's twin sister, Capris in a family even more deadly than her other kin, the Mafia, it looks like there's trouble abound. As if the former duo weren't scary enough! One has to hope her intentions are not self-serving, as she is guarding their sprits while they battle the Conquistador. Don't miss this exciting finale of the 3 part Ripclaw story arc!

SPOILERS

While visiting the spiritworld, jackie sees the death of his father.
name: Ripclaw (Part Three)

description: Having traveled to the very heart of the Darkness it self, Jackie Estacado is stunned by the opportunity that Robert Bearclaw presents him. The chance for a one on one encounter with Jackie's mother hours before his birth.
name: Ripclaw (Part Four)

description: Jackie Estacado has barely completed his training with RIPCLAW, when THE DARKNESS is forced to battle THE CONQUISTATOR and his legion of Hostile Cherubs! But will even these two be enough to stem the coming Blood Tide -- or is Jackie going to have to look towards his sister Capris for help!?
name: Ripclaw (Part Five)

description: As if the power of THE DARKNESS were not terrifying enough -- look what happens when Capris and Jackie combine their powers to stop the Hostile Cherubs! And while Jackie finds himself inadvertantly fighting to prevent the world from falling to the Blood TIde...it means he's not able to testify as the key witness in the State's case against Frankie Franchetti! And what would the EXCITING CONCLUSION of the RIPCLAW five part story be...without a startling bang revelation by Jenny Romano?!

Darkness falls, The 40th issue of the Darkness is guaranteed to be a shocker as Jackie Estacado finally acknowledges his love for his childhood friend JENNY. Will he make the ULTIMATE SACRIFICE for the one he loves? DEATH, BLOOD, GORE, SEX and fun are only a few of the elements that will make this the most un-&%#@&^%-ing believable issue of the Darkness yet!
A summary of the Darkness and events in The Darkness series.
